bibl.title: Jennie Miller Powers v. Mary Elizabeth Miller and R. J. Miller. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: King County Government, Judicial Administration. Territorial District Court Case Files, 1867-1889

div1.p: In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Seattle in King County
In the matter of the application of Jennie Miller Powers for a writ of Habeas Corpus} Order granting writ

Upon reading and filing the petition of Jennie Miller Powers only signed and verifiied by her wherein it appears that Mary Alice Powers an infant child of said Jennie Miller Powers is illegally restrained confined and detained from the rightful custody of said Jennie Miller Powers in King County Washington Territory and stating wehrein the alleged illegality consists from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue, it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory directed to the said Mary Elizabeth Miller and to J RJ Miller her husband commanding then and each of them to have the body of the said Mary Alice Powers before me at my Chambers in the Court House of said King County on the 10h day of April at 10 oclock AM of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning said Mary Alice Powers the minor child of said petitioner Jennie Miller Powers together with the time and cause of her detention and that
you have then and there the said writ
